variables.name: EVENT_ID
variables.comment:
* The event that the alert belongs to. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (foreign key to the Events table)

variables.name: BEGIN
variables.comment:
* The start time of the event, in UTC. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: END
variables.comment:
* The end time of the event, in UTC. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: ALARM_TIME
variables.comment:
* The alarm time of the event, in UTC. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: CREATION_TIME
variables.comment:
* The creation time of this database entry, in UTC. * Useful for debugging missed reminders. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: RECEIVED_TIME
variables.comment:
* The time that the alarm broadcast was received by the Calendar app, * in UTC. Useful for debugging missed reminders. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: NOTIFY_TIME
variables.comment:
* The time that the notification was created by the Calendar app, * in UTC. Useful for debugging missed reminders. Column name. *

Type: INTEGER (long; millis since epoch)

variables.name: STATE
variables.comment:
* The state of this alert. It starts out as {@link #STATE_SCHEDULED}, then * when the alarm goes off, it changes to {@link #STATE_FIRED}, and then when * the user dismisses the alarm it changes to {@link #STATE_DISMISSED}. Column * name. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: STATE_SCHEDULED
variables.comment: * An alert begins in this state when it is first created.

variables.name: STATE_FIRED
variables.comment:
* After a notification for an alert has been created it should be
         * updated to fired.

variables.name: STATE_DISMISSED
variables.comment:
* Once the user has dismissed the notification the alert's state should
         * be set to dismissed so it is not fired again.

variables.name: MINUTES
variables.comment:
* The number of minutes that this alarm precedes the start time. Column * name. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: DEFAULT_SORT_ORDER
variables.comment: * The default sort order for this alerts queries
